title: Plant Disease by Image Classification
description: Binary classification of plant disease by image classification.

project_overview.objective: Develop a neural network model to classify images of plants as either diseased or healthy. This is a binary classification problem where the model must decide between two possible categories.
project_overview.approach: Used transfer learning with ConvNeXtBase, a pre-trained convolutional neural network. Transfer learning helps improve performance and speeds up training by leveraging pre-existing knowledge from a large dataset.

base_model.name: ConvNeXtBase
base_model.description: A convolutional neural network pre-trained on ImageNet. The first 277 layers are frozen, and the remaining layers are fine-tuned for plant disease classification.

dense_layers.description: Additional fully connected layers that process the output from the base model.
features: Leaky ReLU activation functions to improve learning speed.
Dropout to prevent overfitting by randomly ignoring some neurons during training.
Batch Normalization to stabilize and speed up training.
Ridge Regularization to control model complexity and prevent overfitting.

training_and_tuning.dataset: 5,004 images split into training (80%) and validation (20%) sets.

hyperparameter_tuning.description: Adjusted various settings like activation functions and regularization methods to find the best-performing model.
techniques: Data augmentation (zooming, flipping, rotating images) to improve model robustness.

results.description: The ConvNeXtBase model showed strong performance with low overfitting. It effectively classified healthy and diseased plants with high accuracy and balanced precision and recall.

team_contributions.description: The project was a collaborative effort where each member contributed to different aspects, ensuring a smooth workflow and leveraging each person's strengths.
